info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:50PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL MONROE... NORTHEASTERN CLARKE AND SOUTHWESTERN WILCOX COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Fulton, or 5 miles southeast of Thomasville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fulton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
